stanza.line: Not mine own fears nor the propheticsoul
Of the wide world dreaming on things to come
Can yet the lease of my true lovecontrol
Supposed as forfeit to a confined doom
The mortal moon hath her eclipseendured
And the sad augurs mock their own presage
And peace proclaims olives of endless age
Now with the drops of this most balmytime
My love looks fresh and death to mesubscribes
Since spite of him Ill live in this poorrhyme
While he insults oer dull and speechlesstribes
And thou in this shalt find thy monument
When tyrants crests and tombs of brass are spent
